message: #Ubuntu the great #Linux operating system has C# code in it. I love this language & I'll always be. http://www.ohloh.net/p/ubuntu

data.message:
أول مرة أعرفها ! ويمكن أخر حاجة اتوقعها !
بس اتبسط والله وزادت ثقتي في اللغة اللي بحبها برده اكتر :)
I dont think that this is correct, can u plz post more sources ?
هو الاكيد انة مش فى الcore بتاع السيستم.  بس فى بعض برامج سطح المكتب زى Banshee.
Microsoft have participated in developing some parts of the Kernel and other components for linux.  http://www.theregister.co.uk/2013/09/16/linux_foundation_kernel_report_2013/

C# could be compiled and run on linux using mono, C# specs is open for anyone to implement it so Mono came out with the implementation for  linux systems, and some default applications on ubuntu is written using C# like banshee and tomboy.

C# can run on linux, that's right. However, to contribute to the kernel, you "have to" write in C (and some assembly; if you can!). This is by design to hopefully reduce the overhead to the minimal, and to be close to the hardware layer. Also there is a technical issue behind it:

In linux, there is a difference between user- and kernel-space modules/programs. .net applications requires using .net vm which runs in user space; you can't develop linux kernel with C# since it requires user-space vm.

The Ohloh page is inaccurate, these links may help:
http://www.quora.com/Ohloh/Why-is-Ubuntu-considered-mostly-written-in-C-by-ohloh
http://askubuntu.com/questions/277055/ubuntu-is-mostly-written-in-c

As an exercise, I downloaded the ubuntu-trusty kernel (http://kernel.ubuntu.com/git?p=ubuntu/ubuntu-trusty.git;a=summary) ~ 1.7 Gb. I ran the CLOC (count lines of code) program on it, and here are the results: 80% C, 17%, C/C++ headers and 2% assembly ~ 99% of the code!

Note: the asp code is not the MS asp for web pages, it is code that runs on DSP (digital signal processor). You can find it here: ./sound/pci/cs46xx/imgs/cwcdma.asp. I believe that the asp.net file will have a similar explanation, but couldn't figure out where it is!

First I didn't say it's the kernel code, I said there is C# code lives inside Ubuntu code repository, it might be like some say apps written in C# and inside the repository, Second yes sure the kernel can't have C# because it's managed code language as Khaled Diab investegate and give us the results.
back to your first statement "Ubuntu the great Linux operating system has C# code in it", I don't think these are ubuntu standard apps, I mean they are not packaged with the official ubuntu, right?
I'm not sure I got this inoformation based in the link I've posted

speaking about C# and OS kernels, a cool bunch of people made a compiler than convers IL to assembly (and something like C# called X#), and they used that to make a managed OS kernel using C# :)
check it out: http://cosmos.codeplex.com/
